definition: could happen at any moment/on the verge
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions
namely/that is/i.e./prompt/at once/at present/even if/prompted (by the occasion)/to approach/to come into contact/to assume (office)/to draw near
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Surgent power output of All New Bora makes your driving pleasure easy on the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 全新寶來澎湃的動力輸出讓您的駕駛樂趣一觸即發。

sentences.english: There is always a danger of marriage taking the razor edge off the passion for Jesus and souls.
sentences.chinese: 闕如對耶穌及對人的熱愛，婚姻的危機常會一觸即發。

sentences.english: Armed conflict may break out at any moment.
sentences.chinese: 武裝衝突有一觸即發之勢。

sentences.english: The prospect of a new trade war.
sentences.chinese: 一觸即發的新一輪貿易戰。

sentences.english: President Adams did not call for a declaration of war, but hostilities began at sea.
sentences.chinese: 亞當斯總統並未宣戰，但是戰爭在海邊一觸即發。

sentences.english: Red and blue hair-trigger World War II this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 紅藍大戰本週末一觸即發。

sentences.english: This can set off the pain cascade with hair-trigger sensitivity.
sentences.chinese: 這種疼痛由一觸即發的敏感靈敏性激發級聯反應。

sentences.english: Revolution is in the air. Can’t you feel it?
sentences.chinese: 現在革命是一觸即發，難道你們感覺不到嗎？

sentences.english: A king and the apostles to the truth and honor campaign triggered at any moment.
sentences.chinese: 一場王爵和使徒們爲了真相和榮譽的戰役一觸即發。

sentences.english: Fortress filling amuck and wars being going to launch.
sentences.chinese: 軍事要塞充滿肅殺感，戰事一觸即發。

sentences.english: Despite the threat of war, people go about their work as usual.
sentences.chinese: 儘管戰爭一觸即發，人們仍像平時一樣工作。

sentences.english: Pachacutec scanned the enemy ranks in silence, preparing for the great battle ahead.
sentences.chinese: 帕恰庫德無聲的審視着敵方陣營，大戰一觸即發。

definition: to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
chaotic situation
the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to discuss spiritedly (idiom)/tongues are wagging
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
bilateral trade
lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
unprecedented/never seen before
to take turns/to work by roster
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw
military operation
social movement/abbr. for 社會運動|社会运动
to stick onto/stalemate/gridlock/to agglutinate
